british_character: Sarah: I am Sarah, an MP who passionately debates in the House of Commons. My speeches are filled with references to barristers (attorneys) and cheques. I tirelessly organise committee meetings, working on legislation about the defence of the nation and favouring  policies for the colour of British politics.
american_character: David: My name is David, I am a Congressman who drafts defense bills and checks complex legislation. My days are filled with lobbying and favoring healthcare reforms. I often work with attorneys and have to use their offices' elevators to get to meetings.

british_character: Henry: I am Henry, mostly amidst the bustling streets of London dealing with the Pound Sterling and analyses of the favour of international markets. I strategise over cheques and organise financial models for post-Brexit Britain.
american_character: Emily: I am Emily and I work as a stockbroker, navigating the stocks and bonds of Wall Street. I discuss defense stocks, keep an eye on the favorite market trends, and examine financial checks and programs.

british_character: Olivia: My name is Olivia and I enjoy the tranquillity of the English countryside, attending programmes at local community centres and relishing the flavour of traditional English tea. My days are spent in gardens (yards), embracing the colour of rural life.
american_character: John: I am John and I live in a busy American suburb, balancing work and family life. I spend weekends on soccer fields and enjoys vacations, epitomizing the suburban American lifestyle.

british_character: Elizabeth: My name is Elizabeth, I am a student at the University of Oxford, immersing myself in an academic environment steeped in tradition. My days are packed with lectures and tutorials, and I am often seen carrying binders full of organised notes. I spend my evenings in the library, deeply engrossed in research for my dissertation, a critical part of my curriculum vitae.
american_character: Michael: My name is Michael, I am studying at Harvard University, experiencing the diverse and demanding nature of American higher education. My backpack is always filled with textbooks and my laptop, essential tools for my research projects. I am active in extracurriculars, from debate clubs to sports teams, showcasing the dynamic campus life.

british_character: Aisha: Hi, I am Aisha, residing in the heart of London, reveling in the city's multicultural vibrancy. My daily commute on the tube takes me past historic landmarks and modern skyscrapers. I often meet friends at a local pub for a quick chat or a hearty meal. Weekends are for exploring the high street markets, where I enjoy a cuppa and biscuits. Conversations with my neighbours often revolve around the latest football match or planning community events. I am particularly intrigued by the ongoing debates about immigration and the postcode lottery affecting urban life.
american_character: Carlos: My name is Carlos, I am living in the bustling melting pot of New York City, navigating a life filled with diversity. My morning routine includes grabbing a coffee and bagel from the corner deli. Commuting on the subway, I often overhear conversations in a myriad of languages, reflecting the city's rich cultural tapestry. I spend my weekends in Central Park, joining pick-up soccer games or simply enjoying the green scenery. Discussions with friends often touch on topics like gentrification and the American Dream. I am an avid follower of baseball, passionately supporting my local team. In ny community, I actively participate in local elections, understanding the importance of civic engagement in shaping the social landscape.
